definition: to drop/to fall/to come down/to descend
to decline/to drop/to fall/to go down/to decrease
to cut the price/to drive down the price/to get cheaper
to become cooler/to lower the temperature/cooling/(of interest, activity etc) to decline
to drop from the sky/(fig.) to appear out of nowhere/(attributive) airborne

sentences.english: The twisting and moving slowed down, halting the lights.
sentences.chinese: 星雲旋轉和轉動的速度降了下來，亮度也變暗了。

sentences.english: Position the hose at a downspout drain to discharge then let go of the crimp.
sentences.chinese: 位置處於降排水軟管燃放然後放過了捲曲。

sentences.english: She bought a coat that had been knocked down to half-price.
sentences.chinese: 她買了一件降了一半價的衣服。

sentences.english: Also, a formula calculating the pressure drop of series throttle holes in the liquid propellant transporting sys…
sentences.chinese: 文中還給出了液路系統中各串聯節流孔壓降公式。

sentences.english: The universe in Oneness awaits your ascension.
sentences.chinese: 開一的宇宙期待您狄罪降。

sentences.english: The flight was forced to land in Russia due to mis-entry.
sentences.chinese: 航班因爲誤闖而被迫降俄羅斯。

sentences.english: He turned round and went back again.
sentences.chinese: 他掉蹤降轉頭又回往了。

sentences.english: I will join in the assault upon Icecrown Citadel when the time to strike upon us.
sentences.chinese: 我將會在時機降臨時加入攻打冰冠城塞的最後一戰。

sentences.english: As a rule competition reduces the difference in the prices on the same products to a minimum.
sentences.chinese: 一般來說，同類產品的競爭可將價格差異降至最低。

sentences.english: Diligence and discipline can reduce the incidence of these errors to near zero.
sentences.chinese: 勤奮和自律可以讓這些錯誤造成的影響降至最低限度。

sentences.english: Chaton brand BT - 2002 type powerful grounding resistance reduction agent committed to lightning protection of the overall program.
sentences.chinese: 型強效接地降阻劑致力於雷電防護的整體方案。

sentences.english: The economic growth dipped to a low point last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年經濟增長速度降至低點。

sentences.english: Rewards and penalties, promotions and demotions should be based on work performance.
sentences.chinese: 要根據工作成績的大孝好壞，有賞有罰，有升有降。

sentences.english: As night fell, work went on by oil lamp and candlelight.
sentences.chinese: 夜幕降臨時，僧侶們點起油燈和蠟燭，繼續幹活。

sentences.english: The total pressure drop in hung-up regime is approximately equal to that in the standpipe.
sentences.chinese: 並且證明懸料區的總壓降可以近似等於立管的壓降。

sentences.english: That it should rain on the earth without man in the wilderness, where no mortal dwelleth.
sentences.chinese: 好使雨落在無人之境，降在無人的荒野。

definition: variant of 升[sheng1]/to ascend/to rise in rank
to decline/to drop/to fall/to go down/to decrease
to lower/to decrease/to reduce/to subtract/to diminish
to adjust downwards/to lower (prices, wages etc)
to demote/to pass down to a lower unit
to cut the price/to drive down the price/to get cheaper
low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline
to rise again after a fall/to pick up/rally (stock market etc)
(Tw) to lower (prices, interest rates etc)/to reduce/to cut
(of water) to soar/(of prices) to skyrocket
